# MDChelp

Last updated 12/03/2025

The goal of MDChelp is to provide functions and demonstrations of common
statistical methods in fish/ wildlife research.

## Installation

You can install the development version of MDChelp from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r

options(download.file.method = "wininet")
# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("tlyons253/MDChelp")
```

See “Articles” in the menu for a list of potentially helpful articles on
methods and techniques. If there is a topic you are interested in, or an
analysis you do frequently, let me know and I can develop articles or
functions to include in the `MDChelp` package.

# Package index

## data simulation

- [`surv_sim1()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/surv_sim1.md)
  : A simple survival simulation.
- [`LP.sim()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/LP.sim.md)
  : Lincoln-Petersen Simulation

## closed capture

- [`LP.sim()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/LP.sim.md)
  : Lincoln-Petersen Simulation
- [`chapman()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/chapman.md)
  : Chapman Estimator for closed populations

## misc

- [`logexp()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/logexp.md)
  : logistic exposure link function.

## non-parametric bootstrapping

- [`boot_cluster()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/boot_cluster.md)
  : Resample clustered data
- [`bootstrap_interval()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/bootstrap_interval.md)
  : Compute bias-corrected, accelerated confidence intervals for
  non-parametric bootstrapped parameter estimates.
- [`est_accelerate()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/est_accelerate.md)
  : Jacknife procedure to estimate the acceleration constant
- [`jacknife_data()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/jacknife_data.md)
  : Jacknife data helper function
- [`resamp.fxn()`](https://tlyons253.github.io/MDChelp/reference/resamp.fxn.md)
  : Resampling helper function
